synthesis_conditions.description: Single crystals of SIFSIX-23-Cu-α are prone to lose guest molecules in air at RT. When fresh crystals of SIFSIX-23-Cu-α were filtered from reaction solution and dried in air for about 1 day, SCXRD demonstrated the formation of a new phase, SIFSIX-23-Cu-γ1.
Heating the air dried sample at 60 oC for about 2 hours resulted in the isolation of SIFSIX-23-Cu-γ2.
Further heating the air dried sample or the SIFSIX-23-Cu-γ2 phase at 80 oC for 2 hours produced SIFSIX-23-Cu-γ3.
Heating the air dried sample or the isolated intermediate phases at 120 oC for 3 hours resulted in the generation of the SIFSIX-23-Cu-β1 phase.
Heating the air dried sample or the isolated intermediate phases at 160 oC overnight produced the SIFSIX-23-Cu-β2 phase.
